Hi FS105,That Authorization number you received from MS may have been given because at that time you couldn't activate FSX with its own Product Key or you had lost the key.   That MS number would not be useful for a fresh install to a new PC;  you'll need to use the Product Number affixed on the FSX packet.   If you don't have it, then maybe you could try to use that old MS number or else you will need to contact MS for it.   To get the phone number applicable for your country, you will need to go into the FSX Directory (after installing it of course) and then find the file (Phone Activation.xml) to get the number.   The down-side of this is, is that the list in that file is now so old that it may not be useful.    As well, your question was pertaining to the location of the Authorization number (Activation Key) box after installing FSX.   After you install Disks 1 and 2, one of the last prompts will be for activation of the product.   If you don't get this prompt, either there may not be a need for further activation (as some of us experience when re-installing FSX a number of times on the same computer), or there is a glitch in the activation process.The two ways to tell if FSX is activated is:   1.   after taking a flight, FSX stops working after about thirty minutes then it is not activated, and   2.    open up a flight (i.e. to the point when you are seated in a cockpit) and press  Alt  to open up the top Menu bar.  Then go to   Help   and then to   About Microsoft Flight Simulator.   At the bottom there should be a Product ID.   If it is there then this indicates that your FSX is activated.  Chris

I would like to thank both Greg Carmack and Criso747 for their immediate responses and assistance.  I did use Criso747's procedure for finding the Microsoft Activation phone number and it still works okay as of 1/10/2020.  However, my authorization number was not accepted.The very good news here is that my activation was successful after re-entering my Product Key correctly!  I misread a "B' as an "8".  Mea culpa!
Thanks for letting us know, FS105.   Happy Flying.Chris
